title: Implement tail command support for OpenCode backend
Fix: orch spawn --issue fails with project registry mismatch
description:
BUG: `orch spawn --issue <id>` fails even when in an orch project directory.

REPRODUCTION:
1. cd /Users/dylanconlin/Documents/personal/orch-cli
2. orch projects scan  # finds orch-cli
3. orch spawn research --issue orch-cli-vny
4. Error: Project 'orch-cli' not found (from --project)

OBSERVED:
- `orch projects scan` finds and caches orch-cli
- But `orch spawn --issue` says project not found
- Available projects list shows different projects (orch-knowledge, price-watch, etc.)

EXPECTED:
- Should spawn successfully since we're in the orch-cli directory

LIKELY CAUSE:
- Two different project registries/caches being used
- Or --issue flag triggers different project lookup logic than auto-detect
close_reason: Fixed: pass project_dir to spawn_with_skill to skip re-resolution when auto-detected

title: Review and update orch init - creates outdated file structure
description:

**Expected:**

- Update to match how projects are actually structured now
- Remove references to deprecated commands/patterns

**Triggered by:** Initializing orch-cli itself and noticing the mismatch
close_reason: Fixed in 5db06a7 - removed deprecated build-orchestrator-context reference, added graceful template handling

title: Phase 3: Update orch commands to read from beads
description:
## Context
From investigation: .orch/investigations/design/2025-12-01-orch-cli-role-in-agent-ecosystem.md

Final phase: orch commands read/write beads instead of workspace files.

## Scope
- `orch status` reads from `bd list` instead of parsing workspace files
- `orch complete` runs `bd close` with summary
- `orch check` shows beads issue details

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `orch status` shows agent state from beads
- [ ] `orch complete` closes associated beads issue
- [ ] `orch check` displays beads issue content
- [ ] No workspace file parsing in monitoring_commands.py

title: Phase 2: Remove workspace file creation from spawn
description:
## Context
From investigation: .orch/investigations/design/2025-12-01-orch-cli-role-in-agent-ecosystem.md

After beads-first spawning is default, remove workspace file creation.

## Scope
- Stop creating WORKSPACE.md in spawn.py
- SPAWN_CONTEXT.md can still exist (injected into agent, ephemeral)
- Or move SPAWN_CONTEXT into beads issue description

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] spawn.py no longer creates .orch/workspace/{name}/WORKSPACE.md
- [ ] Agents can still function without workspace file
- [ ] All execution state flows through beads

title: Phase 1: Make beads-first spawning the default
description:
## Context
From investigation: .orch/investigations/design/2025-12-01-orch-cli-role-in-agent-ecosystem.md

Workspaces duplicate beads functionality. Converging workspace state into beads issues.

## Scope
- `orch spawn --issue bd-xxx` already works
- Make it the default/primary path
- Update agent guidance to write progress to beads comments instead of workspace

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Spawning from beads issue is documented as preferred approach
- [ ] Agent skill guidance updated to use `bd comment` for progress
- [ ] SPAWN_CONTEXT template updated to reference beads issue

title: Create kb project - knowledge artifact tooling
description:
## Context
From decision: .orch/decisions/2025-12-01-five-concerns-architecture.md

Extract knowledge artifact management from orch-cli into dedicated kb tool.

## Scope
- kb create investigation <slug>
- kb create decision <slug>
- kb create pattern <slug>
- kb search <query>
- kb list investigations|decisions|patterns
- Establish .kb/ directory structure
- Move investigation/decision templates from orch

## Why
orch-cli (lifecycle) shouldn't create knowledge artifacts. Separation of concerns.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] kb CLI exists with create/search/list commands
- [ ] .kb/ directory structure documented
- [ ] Templates moved from ~/.orch/templates/ to kb project
- [ ] orch-cli investigations.py and decisions.py removed

title: Create skills project - agent guidance tooling
description:
## Context
From decision: .orch/decisions/2025-12-01-five-concerns-architecture.md

Extract skill authoring/building/deployment from orch-knowledge into dedicated skills tool.

## Scope
- skills build - compile SKILL.md from phases/techniques
- skills deploy - install to ~/.claude/skills/
- skills list - show available skills
- skills new <category>/<name> - scaffold new skill
- Move skills/src/ from orch-knowledge

## Why
Skills (prescriptive guidance) are different from knowledge (descriptive learnings). Separate concerns.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] skills CLI exists with build/deploy/list/new commands
- [ ] skills/src/ structure documented
- [ ] Build system extracted from orch-knowledge
- [ ] orch-cli still consumes skills from ~/.claude/skills/ (no change needed)

title: Investigate Go vs Python vs Rust for CLI tools (beads, vc, orch-cli)
description:
Steve Yegge's beads and vc projects are both written in Go:
- /Users/dylanconlin/Documents/personal/beads
- /Users/dylanconlin/Documents/personal/vc

orch-cli is written in Python:
- /Users/dylanconlin/Documents/personal/orch-cli

**Questions to explore:**
1. What benefits does Go provide for CLI tools like beads/vc?
2. How does Python compare for orch-cli's use case?
3. Would Rust be a better choice than either?

**Consider:**
- Startup time / performance
- Distribution (single binary vs dependencies)
- Cross-platform support
- Developer ergonomics
- Ecosystem for CLI tooling
close_reason: Research complete. Recommend Go for CLI tools - 40ms startup vs Python 108ms, single binary distribution. See .orch/investigations/feasibility/2025-12-02-go-python-rust-cli-comparison.md
